title: Inpainting KITTI images results in a completely white image
body:
Hi,
I managed to implement your code for the NYU dataset and it worked like a charm, I even merged a PR which updated the testing and training code to work with latest Keras documentation.
My aim is to train this code on the KITTI dataset, but when I'm using the depth inpainting method code that is there in the README, I seem to be getting a completely white image. This seems to be because even the minimum value of a pixel in the resultant image is well over 255. 
The code I'm using is :
```
image_depth = np.array(Image.open('D:/kitti/train/2011_09_26_drive_0018_sync/proj_depth/groundtruth/image_02/0000000005.png'))
image_rgb = np.array(Image.open('D:/2011_09_26/2011_09_26_drive_0018_sync/image_02/data/0000000005.png'))
image_depth_filled = fill_depth_colorization(imgRgb=image_rgb,imgDepthInput=image_depth,alpha=1)
print(image_depth.min(), image_depth.max())
print(image_depth_filled.min(), image_depth_filled.max())
```
And when I'm checking the output for both the depth and the filled arrays the minimum value is causing my inpainted image to be as completely white.

```
0 20211
1532.0 20211.0
```

The resultant image I'm getting for the particular image after inpainting:
Original
![0000000005](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42406413/95018370-ec979300-067c-11eb-84ff-6c00e159c569.png)
After Inpainting
![img](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42406413/95018344-ca057a00-067c-11eb-8c58-fa17e0948be4.png)

Any help with this would be appreciated. Thanks.
